name: romantically
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that relates to love or a close loving relationship: We were good friends before we became romantically involved.
in an exciting and mysterious way that has a strong effect on your emotions: Artists have viewed the landscape as romantically beautiful.
sometimes disapproving in a way that is not practical and involves ideas that are not related to real life: It did not achieve the results that you romantically suggested it would. See
romantic
More examplesFewer examplesWhat about the question of whether she was romantically involved with a member of Congress?I love flowers, but I don't like receiving them romantically. Gossip columns have linked him romantically with a variety of women. The man informed Owens he could not be romantically interested in the woman because she was his half-sister.The letters all began romantically, "To my love".He was a hero who romantically incarnated the religious poetry of his age.I found some of her views romantically out of key with the present.
